intro: Rhytispermum fruticosum, commonly known as the shrub of the genus Rhytispermum, is a rare and lesser-known plant species. It is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky or arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
